title: Former US President Bill Clinton Hospitalised With Fever
description: Former Democratic U.S. President Bill Clinton, 78, was hospitalized on Monday with a fever, according to his deputy chief of staff.
excerpt: Former Democratic U.S. President Bill Clinton, 78, was hospitalized on Monday with a fever, according to his deputy chief of staff.
text: "He is in good spirits and grateful for the care he is receiving," the hospital said. Washington: Former Democratic U.S. President Bill Clinton, 78, was hospitalized on Monday with a fever, according to his deputy chief of staff.It is not an emergency situation, NBC News reported."President Clinton was admitted to Georgetown University Medical Center this afternoon for testing and observation after developing a fever," Angel Ureña wrote on X."He is in good spirits and grateful for the care he is receiving."(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.) html:
"He is in good spirits and grateful for the care he is receiving," the hospital said.

Washington:

Former Democratic U.S. President Bill Clinton, 78, was hospitalized on Monday with a fever, according to his deputy chief of staff.

It is not an emergency situation, NBC News reported.

"President Clinton was admitted to Georgetown University Medical Center this afternoon for testing and observation after developing a fever," Angel Ureña wrote on X.

"He is in good spirits and grateful for the care he is receiving."

(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
